title: Police search Bahrain Victorious Tour de France team hotel
content:
Police search Bahrain Victorious Tour de France team hotel

French police searched the Bahrain Victorious team hotel on Wednesday after the conclusion of stage 17 of the Tour de France.

“Nothing special, we have a visit from the police, they ask for riders training files, they check bus and that’s it,” Bahrain Victorious general manager Milan Eržen told Cyclingnews. “They disturb riders for one hour and at the end, they said thank you. They didn’t tell us what’s the reason of visit, but we will found this out today through lawyers.”

Pau, the scene of the raid, has a weird history with the Tour de France. It was where Frank Schleck left the Tour de France after a positive doping test in 2012 and where Lance Armstrong held his infamous press conference to deny allegations of cheating.

It seems the legacy of Pau continues with news of the Bahrain Victorious raid, although no arrests were made, the police did seize training files from the team.

This story is ongoing.
